title: Griffin Neame
text:
Griffin Neame (born 1 March 2001) is a <a href="New%20Zealander">New Zealand</a> professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Neame was born in <a href="Greymouth">Greymouth</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>.
He played his junior rugby league for Suburbs Rugby League Club and attended <a href="Greymouth%20High%20School">Greymouth High School</a> before being signed by the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2017, Neame represented the New Zealand Residents under-16 side against the NZ Māori under-17 team.
In 2019, Neame played for the <a href="Townsville%20Blackhawks">Townsville Blackhawks</a> in the <a href="Mal%20Meninga%20Cup">Mal Meninga Cup</a> and <a href="Hastings%20Deering%20Colts">Hastings Deering Colts</a> competitions. In September 2019, he represented the <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a>.
On 7 October 2020, Neame joined North Queensland's NRL squad on a development contract for the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 season</a>.
2021.
Neame began the 2021 season playing for the Blackhawks in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>. On 12 May, Neame re-signed with the North Queensland club until the end of the 2023 season.
In Round 22 of the <a href="2021%20NRL%20season">2021 NRL season</a>, Neame made his NRL debut against the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>.
